title: Great Mosque of Djenné
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 1,269 words, Level W (Grade 4), Lexile 990L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     N and Z1
description: The Great Mosque of Djenné, in Mali, West Africa, is the largest mud-brick building in the world. It's history dates back centuries. The mosque has been completely rebuilt three times over the years. Students read about the history of this amazing structure and discover its important role in Islamic culture in Africa.
highFrequencyWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
